title: Royal Christmas Cards Show Family Love
summary: This article talks about Christmas cards from royal families in Europe. Many cards this year show families hugging, holding hands, and being close to each other. For example, the Prince and Princess of Wales have a card with their family sitting on grass in jeans, looking happy and relaxed. King Charles and Queen Camilla are arm in arm in their card, showing unity. Prince Harry and Meghan have a card with snow and them holding hands. The cards are different from old ones that were more formal and stiff. They make the royals seem like regular families who love each other, which is a nice message for Christmas.

background_read: Christmas cards are a tradition where people send pictures and messages during the holiday season. Royal families in Europe, like those in the UK, often share their own cards to show their family life. This article compares new cards that look casual and loving to old ones that were more formal. It helps us see how royals want to appear friendly and relatable to everyone.
Article_Structure: WHO: Royal families in Europe, including the Prince and Princess of Wales, King Charles and Queen Camilla, and Prince Harry and Meghan.
WHAT: Christmas cards showing families hugging, holding hands, and being close to each other.
WHERE: In places like Norfolk countryside, Rome, and Canada.
WHY: To project an image of royals as relatable and loving families, different from old formal portraits.

perspectives.description: The cards make royals seem like regular families who care for each other, which is a positive change.
